name: Butternut Squash and Turnip Green Soup
author: Jonathan Batchelor
summary: Y'all, this is so good. With a hint of spice and Creole flavor, the butternut squash adds a little sweet to the turnip greens balancing the bitter and sweet. The andouille smoked sausage adds both warmth and flavor to the dish.
ingredients: 1 small butternut squash - peeled, seeded, and chopped
1 (15.5 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained
1 (15.8 ounce) can great northern beans, rinsed and drained
2 (12 ounce) packages Cajun-style andouille sausage, sliced
1 (1.4 ounce) package vegetable soup mix (such as Knorr®)
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Combine butternut squash, reduced-sodium chicken broth, diced tomatoes, water, black beans, great northern beans, turnip greens, 1 1/2 tablespoons olive oil, sugar, Creole seasoning, garlic powder, and salt in a large pot over medium-high heat
Meanwhile, heat remaining olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat
Cook and stir sausage and onion in the hot skillet until sausage is browned and crumbly and onion is translucent, 5 to 7 minutes
Add regular chicken broth and scrape up all the browned bits on the bottom of the skillet
Pour the mixture into the soup pot
Reduce heat and simmer soup until squash and greens are tender, about 45 minutes
